title: Japan coach Jamie Joseph angered by Scotland legal threats if World Cup clash cancelled by Typhoon Hagibis
text:
Japan’s coach Jamie Joseph has reacted angrily to the “undermining” of his team and rejected suggestions that the hosts would rather advance to the quarter-finals without playing Scotland.

He complained too about “legal challenges” - a clear reference to Scotland’s threat to litigate if their game is cancelled.

Joseph was plainly furious as he prefaced his team announcement with an attack on media reports and the noises emanating from the Scotland camp. He said: “Just in the past few days through the media reports I’ve read, I feel they’ve undermined the achievements of the Japanese national team and the significance of Sunday’s Test match against Scotland for Japan.
